209549-d-12-17-08-SOO.Narrative: 487-16 DEPARTING RIVER JCT. WEST FROM THE SIDING TO THE MAIN TRACK IN A WESTWARD DIRECTION ON A CLEAR INDICATION. AS 487 WAS PULLING OUT G80-16 WAS TRAVELING ON THE MAIN, ALSO IN A WESTWARD DIRECTION,AND MADE CONTACT WITH 487'S TRAIN ABOUT FIFTY CARS DEEP. AS A RESULT, INCIDENT CAUSED 2 LOCOMOTIVESAND A TOTAL OF 26 CARS TO DERAIL FROM G80 AND 487'S TRAINS. INITIAL RESPONSE WAS SLOWED DUE TO A PROPANE CYLINDER USED FOR THE DUAL CONTROL SWITCH HEATER, HAD BEEN KNOCKED OFF IT'S MOUNT AND BEGAN LEAKING IN THE WRECKAGE. FIRE DEPARTMENT OFFICIALS WOULD NOT LET ANYONE ENTER THE LOCATION UNTIL THE CYLINDER QUIT LEAKING.  THIS PROPANE LEAK PROMPTED EVACUATION OF 28 INDIVIDUALS FROM NEARBY VETERANSHOME. CREW FROM G80'S TRAIN WAS TRANSPORTED TO HOSPITAL, TREATED & RELEASED. ACTUAL RECORDED SPEED OF G80 46.9 MPH (INTERNAL SYSTEM WILL NOT RECORD TENTHS SO ROUNDED UP TO 47 MPH)

121722008-d-12-17-08-ACEX.Narrative:
ACE TRAIN 2 OPERATING EASTBOUND AT APPROXIMATELY 78MPH WAS STRUCK IN THE SIDE BY A HIGHWAY VEHICLE AT CORRAL HOLLOW RD (MP 69.64) ON THE OAKLAND SUBDIVISION OF THE UPRR RAILROAD IN TRACY CALIFORNIA.TRAIN WAS OPERATING IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL RULES AND SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS. HEADLIGHT WAS ON, BELLWAS RINGING AND HORN WAS SOUNDED ACCORDING TO RULE. HIGHWAY GATE AT CORRAL HOLLOW WERE WORKING AS INTENDED.

VEHICLE FAILED TO STOP AT CROSSING, RAN THROUGH GATES IN DOWN POSITION AND STRUCK LEAD CAR (CAB CAR) OF CONSIST. VEHICLE SUSTAINED SUBSTANTIAL DAMAGE. MINOR DAMAGE  TO ACEX 3306.

NO INJURIES TO PASSENGER OR CREW. OCCUPANTS OF VEHICLE SUSTAINED NON LIFE THREATENING INJURIES AND WERE TAKING TO LOCAL HOSPITALS FOR TREATMENT.

12192008-d-12-19-08-AGCR.Narrative: #2 SWTICH WAS "RUN THROUGH" WHEN TRAIN WAS SHOVED THROUGH TO PREPARE FOR LOADING. GROUND PERSON WATCHED THE SHOVE ENTIRELY AND DID NOT NOTICE THE SWITCH WAS LINED AGAINST HIM AND RAN THROUGH THE SWITCH.  GROUND MAN GAVE THE OK TO START LOADING TOWARD THE WEST OUT OF THE SYSTEM NOT KNOWING WHAT HAD JUST HAPPENED. THE 4TH CAR FROM THE BOTTOM (DRGW 320257)  STOPPED HALFWAY ACROSS THE #2 SWITCH.  AS THE TRAIN WAS BEING LOADED, ONE HALF OF THIS CAR WAS TRAVELING INTO #3 TRACK (WHERE LOADING OCCURRING) AND THE OTHER HALF WAS TRAVELING INTO #2 TRACK.  THIS CAR WAS MOVING ON BOTH #2 AND #3 TRACK (OFFTHE RAILS). THIS CAR STRUCK AND BROUGHT DOWN TWO UTILITY POLES THAT STOOD IN BETWEEN #2 AND #3 TRACK.  TRAIN WAS STOPPED AFTER A PASSING LOADER OPERATOR CONTACTED THE SILO OPERATOR.

TC1208105-d-12-07-08-BNSF.Narrative: A BNSF WESTBOUND TRAIN DERAILED 37 RAILCARS ON BNSF MAIN TRACK.  THE CAUSE OF THIS DERAILMENT WAS ATTRIBUTED TO A BROKEN RAIL AT A FIELD WELD.  THE DERAILED RAILCARS INCLUDED ELEVEN HAZARDOUS MATERIALS TANK CARS (ONE LOAD AND 10 RESIDUES).  UTLX 202192 (DOT 111A100W1 TANK CAR).  FROM EXAMINATION OFTHE MATERIAL AND INFORMATION RECEIVED, TR&D CANNOT SUPORT THIS CAUSE CODE.  TR&D CONTINUING INVESTIGATION. HAZARDOUS INFO-CAR UTLX 202192, STCC 4909230 RELEASED 6,000 GALLONS OF METHANOL, UTLX 204090,, STCC 4900165, RELEASED 140 GALLONS RESIDUE WHICH LAST CONTAINED PETROLEUM CRUDE, TEAX 3405, STCC 4905752, RELEASED 150 GALLONS OF RESIDUE CONTAINED LIQUEFIELD PRTRO, SHPX 221737, STCC 4905752, RELEASED 150 GALLONS OF RESIDUE LAST CONTAINED LIQUEFIELD PETRO, GATX 57709,STCC 4905752, RELEASED 150 GALLONS OF RESIDUE LAST CONTAINED PETRO, DBUX 302743, STCC 4908176, RELEASED 120 GALLONS RESIDUE LASTCONTAINED GASOLINE. TR&D RECOMMENDATION-ALTHOUGH OUR REPORTS DID NOT FIND THE SUPECT WELD TO BE THECAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT, THE DERAILMENT HAS THE CHARACTERISTIC OF A CATASTROPHIC FAILURE OF A TRACKCOMPONENT.  WE ARE RECOMMENDING THAT THIS DERAILMENT BE CLOSED OUT WITH CAUSE CODE T299 - OTHER RAILAND JOINT BARD DEFECTS (CATASTROPHIC FAILURE OF TRACK COMPONENT SUSPECTED AS THE CAUSE BUT NOT FOUND).

THE SWITCH CAUSED FOUR MORE CARS TO DERAIL SO THAT THE 14TH TO 18TH CAR BECAME DERAILED.  THE ENGINEER DETECTED UNUSUAL MOTIONS IN THE TRAIN AT THIS POINT AND BROUGHT THE TRAIN TO A STOP WITHIN 200 FEET OF MILE POST91.7.  A WOOD TRESTLE IS LOCATED AT MILE POST 91.68.  THE 16TH AND 17TH CARS ROLLED OFF THE TRESTLEAS THE TRAIN CAME TO A STOP.

617730-d-12-19-08-IC.Narrative: WHILE SWITCHING CARS, R92091-19 KICKED 5 CARS INTO 1 LOAD WITH HANDBRAKE ON, CARS COUPLED.  THE 6 CARS THEN STARTED TO ROLL OUT OF TRACK.  THE BRAKEMAN MOUNTED LCGX 632 AND ATTEMPTED TO APPLY ANOTHERHANDBRAKE TO STOP CARS.  THE HANDBRAKE ON LCGX 632 FAILED CAUSING ADMX 52646 TO HIT FMLX 1137.  NO CARS WERE DERAILED.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT INSUFFICIENT BRAKES WERE APPLIED ANDTHEN WHEN THE HANDBRAKE FAILED ON LCGX 632 THE IMPACT OCCURRED.

617826-d-12-23-08-IC.Narrative: L55091-23 STAGED 25 LOADS IN THE SIDING AT HERVEY CITY, CUT OFF LITE POWER AND MOVED TO THE MAIN, CWR TRACK.  THE CREW WAS SHOVING BACK TOWARDS 25 EMPTIES WITH TWO LITE ENGINES AND FAILED TO STOP SHORT OF THE CARS RESULTING IN AN EXCESSIVELY HARD COUPLING.  THE CONDUCTOR WAS RIDING IN THE CAB OF THELEADING LOCOMOTIVE AND FAILED TO STOP THE ENGINEER IN TIME.  THE LOCOMOTIVES STRUCK THE STANDING CUT OF 25 EMPTIES ON THE MAIN.  NO CARS OR LOCOMOTIVES WERE DERAILED, HOWEVER UNIT CN 5799 SUSTAINED HEAVY DAMAGES AND THE IMPACTED CAR.  LCGX 414, WAS DAMAGED.
